docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Feb. 6. -- The Argentine Foreign Office denied today dispatches from Chile saying that South American governments were engaged in diplomatic conversations looking toward uniform legislation to deprive Communists of citizenship.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Feb. 6. -- The Argentine Foreign Office denied today dispatches from Chile saying that South American governments were engaged in diplomatic conversations looking toward uniform legislation to deprive Communists of citizenship.
docs.abstract: Denial of plan to end citizenship of Communists

headline.main: DENIES PLAN TO END CITIZENSHIP OF REDS; But Buenos Aires Admits South American Talks on Stricter Enforcement of Pacts.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: In the vicinity of the Winter Olympics at Garmisch-Partenkirchen in the Bavarian Alps there are some highly conspicuous road signs today. They are the anti-Jewish placards and streamers which correspondents say have been removed for the Olympic...
docs.lead_paragraph: In the vicinity of the Winter Olympics at Garmisch-Partenkirchen in the Bavarian Alps there are some highly conspicuous road signs today. They are the anti-Jewish placards and streamers which correspondents say have been removed for the Olympic Games.

docs.snippet: SANTIAGO, Chile, Feb. 7 (AP). -President Arturo Alessandri and General Luis Cabrera, Minister of the Interior, signed a decree tonight declaring a state of siege in all of Chile south of the Province of Aconcagua. The decree, issued in connection...
docs.lead_paragraph: SANTIAGO, Chile, Feb. 7 (AP). -President Arturo Alessandri and General Luis Cabrera, Minister of the Interior, signed a decree tonight declaring a state of siege in all of Chile south of the Province of Aconcagua. The decree, issued in connection with the five-day-old strike on the national railways, will be effective for three months.

headline.main: CHILE IS SUBJECTED TO STATE OF SIEGE; Decree Caused by Railway Strike Affects Most of Country -150 'Communists' Jailed.

headline.main: VALUE OF EXPORTS ROSE IN DECEMBER; Month's Revised Total Is Put at $223,515,105, Against $170,653,797 in 1934. $186,863,874 IN IMPORTS December Total in 1934 Set at $132,258,059 in Department of Commerce Report.

byline.original: Special to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: VALPARAISO, Chile, Feb. 8. -- The discovery of Communist inspiration for the railroad strike, which threatened to envelop other public services and industries, has set in motion a series of measures adopted by the government today to break up...
docs.lead_paragraph: VALPARAISO, Chile, Feb. 8. -- The discovery of Communist inspiration for the railroad strike, which threatened to envelop other public services and industries, has set in motion a series of measures adopted by the government today to break up socialistic activities that have been traced to the Communist headquarters in Montevideo, Uruguay, according to the announcement.
docs.abstract: state of siege ordered; govt's foes arrested

headline.main: CHILE LAYS STRIKE TO RED AGITATORS; Railroad Tie-Up Said to Have Been Part of Program to Overthrow Government. STATE OF SIEGE ORDERED Former Political Leaders and Opposition Journalists Are Arrested in Santiago.

headline.main: OLD SPIRIT OF REVOLT STIRS SOUTH AMERICA; Communism, Now Blamed for All Kinds of Unrest, Is a Force in Only Two of the Republics

byline.original: By JOHN W. WHITE.Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: CUBAN Senoras and Senoritas voted in the recent national election for the first time in the island's history -- a right they gained following the Pan-American conference in Montevideo in 1934, when Cuba, Uruguay, Paraguay and Ecuador signed a treaty...
docs.lead_paragraph: CUBAN Senoras and Senoritas voted in the recent national election for the first time in the island's history -- a right they gained following the Pan-American conference in Montevideo in 1934, when Cuba, Uruguay, Paraguay and Ecuador signed a treaty granting equal rights to women.

headline.main: FOREIGN EXCHANGE RATES; WEEK ENDED FEB. 8, 1936.
